text: Robert Half Technology is seeking a Business Analyst!
For consideration, please email resume to Madison.mcclintock@rht.com.

The Business Application Analyst will focus on the reviewing, analyzing, developing technical solutions to business problems and evaluation of business systems and user needs and documenting requirements, defining scopes and objectives, and formulating systems to parallel overall business strategies.

Responsibilities also include assessing needs and formulating solutions through the use of the organization's business software and related applications; initiating and leading related projects; providing day-to-day support of business systems users and supporting application releases.
o Strong ability to apply technology and business knowledge to solve business problems and create new opportunities.
o Analytical thinker with capacity to break down problems into component parts, identifying implications and outlining timeframes/sequences.
o Basic knowledge of SQL and .NET.
Must have ability to write a SQL query.

Job Description

Kazuhm is looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer to become part of its core team of innovators and visionaries.
To have success on this team you must be flexible, self-directed, inventive and thrive in a fast-paced environment, while delivering amazing results.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for and experience in creating next generation distributed computing systems, containerized micro-services and scalable applications using bleeding edge technologies.

Essential Functions

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or related field5+ years of experience developing commercial applications for WindowsStrong C++, OOP, STL, C++11Knowledge of Visual StudioOne or more of the following languages: Python, Go, or NodeJS

Preferred Qualifications (proven expertise in at least 2 of):

Distributed computing / High Performance ComputingContainers / Container Orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)Networking / RoutingSecurity (best practices, protocols, cryptography, etc.)

Embedded Software Engineer 
If you are an Embedded Software Engineer with expert skills using C/C++, please read on!

Based in Annapolis Junction, MD - We're a leading Cyber-security company providing national security and corporate clients the highest levels of expertise in cyber-security software engineering and analysis.

Our team leverages their mastery of Vulnerability Discovery, Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) Intrusion/Malware Discovery and Analysis, and Secure Software Development to deliver top of the line solutions for our clients all over the world.
Right now, we're looking to bring on an experienced Embedded Software Engineer to assist in developing multiple vulnerability and intrusion discovery and analysis commercial products.

Top Reasons to Work with Us
- Great starting comp + benefits + PTO + 401k- We have a fast-paced environment consistently working on new projects!

What You Need for this Position
- MUST be able to attain DoD Secret Clearance if you don't already have it- 5+ Years in Embedded software development using C/C++- Experience with some or all of the following: IoT, wireless, bluetooth, cell (GSM, CDMA, OpenBTS), microcontrollers, or RF- Bonus Points if you have experience with vulnerability analysis or research experience



So, if you are an Embedded Software Engineer with experience, please apply today!

- Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
 CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer
 
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Job Description






Amazon Web Services is looking for Software Development Engineers to build highly available fault tolerant distributed systems for managing, monitoring, and controlling AWS infrastructure.

Our team is responsible for re-defining the way we think about networking and infrastructure to enable our internal and external customers to continue to scale without limit on the largest, most reliable global infrastructure.
We are looking for innovative, self-motivated candidates with a proven background in scalable distributed systems and web services development in Java, Python or C++ on Linux-based platforms.
In this role you will be a hands-on technical lead responsible for all phases of the project development cycle.
You will work with customers to gather requirements and generate technical designs, and you will carry the project from implementation all the way through validation and operations.
You will use your strong leadership and communication skills to mentor other engineers and provide training and support for our technologies.
Come join us if you want to test your limits and tackle technical challenges you won't see anywhere else.

Basic Qualifications









  Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience   7+ years professional experience in software development













Preferred Qualifications









  Strong knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis   Knowledge of, at least, one modern programming language such as C, C++, Java, or Perl   Experience developing complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers   Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations   Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project   Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs   Experiencing mentoring junior software development engineers and driving engineering excellence   Meets/exceeds Amazon s leadership principles requirements for this role   Meets/exceeds Amazon s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role  Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer   Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.
Apply Now at Amazon

JOB SUMMARY

As Technical Lead for our client, you  ll ideally have several years of experience in a similar leadership role, coupled with strong, hands-on technical ability with embedded software (ideally using Java, Android, and possibly C++).

Our client is a fast-paced, customer-focused consulting business, so you  ll need to be instinctively hard-wired to innovate, communicate and lead by example in all that you do; providing a first-class service to your team and a wide variety of customer stakeholders.
You  ll remotely support one of our technical teams based in Poland; attending regular scrum meetings and providing day-to-day support and mentoring for team members.
The time difference means that these meetings can happen early   often around 6 am Pacific Time   so you  ll need to be flexible in your approach to work and time management.
You  ll spend most of the day working on-site with the customer, meaning that communication and relationship-building are of paramount importance in this role.
As a key customer liaison, you  ll need to excel at explaining complex ideas and issues, as well as documenting highly technical projects, systems and solutions, for both internal and external use.
A key member of our US-based team, you  ll drive the technical direction of projects for a new generation of streaming TV products in an Agile environment.
This will involve working with developers, system engineers, architects, testers and project managers to ensure the successful delivery of a project from a technical perspective.
You  ll work in a relaxed, entrepreneurial environment and will have the freedom to create great solutions and awesome outcomes every day, while working at the cutting-edge of embedded technology.

QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE ROLE 




	Embedded software (C++, C, or Java) development experience

Real-time operating systems experience

Multi-threading experience

Debugging or problem-solving experience in a Linux environment

An established track record of Technical leadership on embedded software projects, coupled with strong hands-on technical skills

Excellent knowledge of C++ or Java in an embedded Linux or Android environment

Strong debug and problem-solving skills using the latest tools

Experienced developing and debugging multi threaded and/or multi process code

Ability to communicate at all levels from developer through technical and/or business executives using appropriate language to translate business objectives into technical terminology and vice versa

Set-Top box experience would be an advantage, but not essential

Previous experience as a Scrum Master and/or Product Owner

Previous Technical Leadership and/or team management would be highly desirable
JAG Global Learning is seeking an Information Technology (IT) professional with experience in Section 508 and Accessibility assessments and testing.

The candidate must be familiar with Section 508 Compliance of document, web page, and eLearning content and will be responsible for reviewing content to ensure that they are Section 508 compliant before submission.

Duties include:

 Reviewing documents, web pages, and eLearning materials for Section 508 compliance.
Testing documents, web pages, and eLearning content for 508 compliance.
Updating content and/or providing guidance to resolve 508 compliance issues.

Requirements

 3-5+ years of preparing, testing, and correcting content for 508 compliance.
Ability to perform complete audits and validation testing on documents, web pages, and eLearning materials based upon Section 508 accessibility guidelines.
Experience testing documents (PDF, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) for Section 508 compliance.
Knowledge on how to create 508 compliant source files and advise on accessibility and other issues in advance.
Advise authors, content developers, and staff on how to ensure documents are compliant.
Must have a keen eye for errors in document structure, headings, reading order, images, lists, charts, tables, and hyperlinks.
Command of MS Office, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Captivate required.
Knowledge of Section 508 requirements for IT software and electronic documents (e.g., PDF, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
High proficiency in Microsoft Office products (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and Adobe Acrobat Professional.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills with solid technical writing skills.

Desired Skills:

 Experience with test planning and testing Familiarity with Federal Government accessibility testing Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Angular, JQuery, SQL, and Web Services Experience in software development using Microsoft stack (C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, etc.)

Benefits

The position is a full-time contract role and is entirely remote.
Must be US citizens.

We re a hands on team interested in the end to end data lifecycle: from wrangling data to understanding the tradeoffs between model complexity and deployment in production.
If you re passionate about solving complex problems with immediate real-world impact, we want you!

Software Development Manager

Our Pennsylvania client is looking for a Software Development Manager to join their Software Development Team.
Their goal is making a difference in healthcare and developing solutions that will help shape the future of medication management.

On a day to day basis, you will help with technical leadership and be responsible for the management of an engineering team that will build, experiment, operate and maintain software to meet business and customer needs.

Responsibilities of the Software Development Manager



Provide technical, process and product leadership in software engineering for the cloud data platform.
Work closely with product owners to ensure your team meets or exceeds product expectations promptly.
Drive software best practices, including design, code review, and unit test development to ensure maximum software quality.
Provide employee development, team building and mentoring including team building and on-boarding.

Work within the team to build product deliverables based on overall architecture direction

Work in an Agile environment implementing complex code changes for specific requirements or applications

Ensure unintentional technical debt is not created

Recommend improvements to the software delivery cycle to help remove waste and impediments for the team

Troubleshoot complex problems with existing or newly-developed software


Basic Qualifications of the Software Development Manager



 Bachelors degree

 7+ years experience in software development, demonstrating increased levels of responsibility and technical expertise.

2+ years of people management experience, leading technical professionals (software developers, development managers, and/or technical program managers)

4+ years' experience in C# and the .NET Framework

1+ years' experience in:



Angular

Microservices architecture

Cloud experience (AWS, Lamdba, Docker, Kubernetes)



Experience with Agile development (especially Scrum and / or Kanban)


Preferred Qualifications of the Software Development Manager



DevOps experience in Cloud technologies like AWS, CloudFront, Kubernetes, VPC, RDS, etc

Experience with .Net core

Healthcare industry experience for inpatient settings


For more information on the Software Development Manager, please contact Marge: mkolkin@compass-sys.com or 603-778-9090

A large media and entertainment company headquartered in Stamford, CT is looking for a Data Engineer to join their team.
Theyre looking for a Data Engineer that can coordinate with cross-functional teams, testing teams, and drive the resolution of open items and issues.
The Data Engineer will need to interface with the business and analytics teams, and will be working within an agile team environment.
The Data Engineer will need experience with Data Warehousing and exposure to the Hadoop ecosystem, including PySpark, Storm, Hive, and other NoSQL databases.
This is a great opportunity to work at a dynamic, fast-paced company that is a globally recognized media firm.

Experience with Data Warehousing within consumer data  Knowledge of Hadoop ecosystem (PySpark, Storm, Hive, HBase)  Familiarity with Python, Java or Scala  Experience with NoSQL databases  Experience using CI/CD frameworks  Agile development experience  Experience or interest in the media industry  Understanding of cloud architecture  Contract Duration: 6-12 months with the potential to go full time
You will receive the following benefits:
 Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA)  401(k)  Paid Sick Time Leave  Pre-tax Commuter Benefit

OVERALL SUMMARY:

As the Analytic Capabilities Lead on the Analytic Capability team, this individual will play a key role in defining and enhancing analytic capabilities within a cloud-based analytic infrastructure by partnering with Technology to manage the publishing of analytic solutions within the enterprise data lake.
He/she will be responsible for management of other analytic support personnel in support of data science and operational analytics team within consumer insights & analytics.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:



Lead the design, deployment and management of insight and analytic end points in cloud-based infrastructure and manage update/refresh cycles
Oversee management of the Consumer Insights & Analytics workspace within AWS
Work with big data engineers in Technology to facilitate publishing of analytic end points in enterprise data lake
Manage the creation of analytic data sets in support of operational analytics and data science team initiatives
Collaborate with both internal teams within Consumer Insights & Analytics and other business units to enforce robust analytic process, continuously build on data engineering learnings and continuous improvement in processes and tooling
Evaluate, acquire and integrate additional sources of data that can enhance analytic capability
Work with appropriate teams to ensure solutions comply with the HBO data governance and security


REQUIREMENTS:



BS or higher in computer science or similar experience
Demonstrated expertise with cloud based, big-data analytic infract support advanced analytic and research functions
Strong hands on expertise with handling structured and unstructured data analytic workflows within a big data platform setting.

Experience with analytic scripting in R, Python and SAS
Excellent communication and project management skills
Flexibility and comfort working in a dynamic organization with minimal documentation and process
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
5+ years of relevant experience

Job Description:

Employer ranks in the top 40 on LinkedIn's 2017 "Top Companies" list.
We offer challenging and meaningful problems, a collaborative culture, and support for your career goals and growth.
We are seeking talented Software Engineers to join our team in enhancing our live streaming video applications and services, which are in active use by our global customers.
This opportunity could be located in Dayton, OH or Charlottesville, VA.

JOB SUMMARY:

You will help build and maintain our live streaming video applications for video analysts.

Because our team works with a variety of languages (C++, Java, Javascript, Python) and technologies (Docker, Puppet, NiFi, etc), we are less concerned with specific skills than proven technical problem solving abilities.

Help us achieve our vision: sub-second latency for live video delivery and playback in both desktop and browser-based clients, with pluggable, horizontally scalable backend components supporting ingest, variable bit rates, and analyst workflows.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:



Design, develop, and debug mission critical software source code.
Participate in the full software development lifecycle.
Research and integrate new technologies into our development and production systems.
Write and prototype API specifications for Test-Driven Development.
Serve as technical lead for small projects and mentor other engineers.
Work on the hardest open problems in live-streamed video.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field and a minimum of 5 years of software engineering experience (experience may be considered in lieu of a degree).- Strong proficiency using at least one high-level programming language (Java, C++, etc.).- Knowledge of Agile Development methodologies.- Familiarity with basic web technologies including HTML, CSS, XML, SOAP, WSDL, REST, JSON, and JavaScript.- Demonstrable problem solving skills.
SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: U.S. citizenship and the ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:



Experience with Test-Driven Development.
Familiarity with at least one Relational Database Management System (Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, etc.).
Familiarity with NoSql databases (Apache Accumulo, MongoDB, etc.).
Experience with Spring or video transcoding.
Prior work or hobbyist projects with ffmpeg, libdash, or angular.js.
QT and/or web graphical user interface development experience.

External Referral Eligible
